page.title: 01Brechin, Angus, Tayside
page.content: {Brechin}is a country town of 7,674 inhabitants. It stands on the{River {Southesk}at the centre of an agricultural community.The farms in the area grow mixed crops with the yellow fields of oil seed rape being a feature of the early summer . The main feature of the town is the 12th-century{cathedral}which made Brechin a city and was partly demolished in 1807.Some of the original fabric is preserved, however including a spire dating from 1360. Next to it stands an even older structure an 87 foot high{round {tower}built in the 10th or 11th century as a watchtower and place of safety for the priest and church treasures.It was here that the cathedral city of Brechin began.
